All Classes All Packages

A

Account - Class in Funds.DataObjects
The Account class will be the primary working tool for organizing the transactions in terms of money coming in or money going out using the standard accounting practice of double-entry method.
Account() - Constructor for class Funds.DataObjects.Account
the default constructor to be used in conjunction with getters and setters
Account(String, boolean) - Constructor for class Funds.DataObjects.Account
For general usage when creating a new account the most important things to know are the name (how to recognize it on the charts) and the normal (which column in the ledger represents an increase), the two-arg constructor implements only this information at creation.
Account(String, String, String, String, String, boolean) - Constructor for class Funds.DataObjects.Account
The full constructor is for creating an account with all the common details, this constructor is intended to be used with a new account dialog interface
AccountCategory - Class in Funds.DataObjects
A identifiable list of accounts of the same primary type so that the Book object has a way to grab only the accounts in a certain category as organized on the balance sheet appearance of the main GUI
AccountCategory(String, AccountType) - Constructor for class Funds.DataObjects.AccountCategory
The list needs to be identifiable and filled with accounts of the same type
AccountCategoryDetailsDialog - Class in Funds.Dialogs
The dialog with options for creating a new category to organize accounts in on the balance sheet rather than one long list, each category will become an expandable/collapsable list of accounts on the balance sheet based primary user interface
AccountCategoryDetailsDialog(Book, AccountType) - Constructor for class Funds.Dialogs.AccountCategoryDetailsDialog
 
AccountDetailsDialog - Class in Funds.Dialogs
Dialog to create a new account, the traditional cornerstone of double-entry method accounting practices: some accounts increase with a debit (left column) and decrease with a credit (right column) while other accounts are the reverse and every dollar recorded is listed in both a debit and a column credit somewhere.
AccountDetailsDialog(Book, AccountType) - Constructor for class Funds.Dialogs.AccountDetailsDialog
The two-arg constructor needs a reference to the current Book and type of account as a string (not the enum value yet) which it gets from context menu on balance sheet tree
AccountDetailsDialog(Book, AccountType, AccountCategory) - Constructor for class Funds.Dialogs.AccountDetailsDialog
The three-arg constructor needs a reference to the current Book and type of account as a string (not the enum value yet) which it gets from context menu on balance sheet tree, and the subcategory which this account goes into
AccountDetailsDialog(Book, Account) - Constructor for class Funds.Dialogs.AccountDetailsDialog
 
AccountLedgerDialog - Class in Funds.Dialogs
This could just be called the "ledger" for each account as that's the old school (paper) model I had in mind for book keeping
AccountLedgerDialog(Book, Account) - Constructor for class Funds.Dialogs.AccountLedgerDialog
In order to interact with the account two fields are necessary:
AccountLedgerDialog.ComboBoxItem - Class in Funds.Dialogs
list item for combo box so that category labels can be included which requires a factory
AccountType - Enum in Funds.DataEnums
List of the available types of accounts the not-null type is for initialization only so that type data exports as an empty string if never modified the all type is used internally when retrieving lists and not an actual account type
activateDate2() - Method in class Funds.Tools.GeneralLedger.LedgerPane
internal method to disable/enable the second date picker when it's needed
addAccount() - Method in class Funds.Dialogs.AccountDetailsDialog
Method to actually create the account from the input fields on the dialog, called when ok button is clicked
addAccountCategory() - Method in class Funds.Dialogs.AccountCategoryDetailsDialog
method to actually create the category when the ok button is clicked
addTransaction() - Method in class Funds.Dialogs.AccountLedgerDialog
uses the values selected/entered for the input fields to create a new Transaction object to represent the details of a real world transaction
addTransfer(Account, boolean) - Method in class Funds.Dialogs.AccountLedgerDialog
Internal method to implement double transaction method accounting
ALL - Funds.DataEnums.AccountType
 
applyFilters() - Method in class Funds.Tools.GeneralLedger.LedgerPane
uses the selected filters to remove items from the list of transactions being shown
ASSET - Funds.DataEnums.AccountType
